required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Long-term Outcomes Following Treatment With ABT-450/Ritonavir/ABT-267 (ABT-450/r/ABT-267) and ABT-333 With or Without Ribavirin (RBV) in Adults With Genotype 1 Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Infection
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Multicenter Study to Evaluate Long-Term Outcomes With ABT-450/Ritonavir/ ABT-267 (ABT-450/r/ABT-267) and ABT-333 With or Without Ribavirin (RBV) in Adults With Genotype 1 Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Infection (TOPAZ-I)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate Long-term outcomes following treatment with ABT-450/r/ABT-267 and ABT-333 with or without RBV in adults with genotype 1 Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infection.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of pre-defined clinical outcomes observed during the studies M14-222 and M14-423
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Post-Treatment week 260 after the last participant of the study M14-222 or M14-423 has taken his/her last dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: Measured by all-cause death, liver-related death, liver decompensation, liver transplantation, and hepatocellular carcinoma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with sustained virologic response 12 weeks post-treatment (SVR12)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last actual dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Hepatitis C ribonucleic acid less than the lower limit of quantification

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Post-Treatment week 260 after the subject has taken his/her last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by change from Day 1 in liver stiffness measured by FibroScan, where available

clinical_study.condition: Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Infection Genotype 1

arm_group.arm_group_label: ABT-450/r/ABT-267 plus ABT-333 with or without ribavirin (RBV)
arm_group.description: ABT-450/r/ABT-267 and ABT-333 coadministered with or without ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks

intervention.arm_group_label: ABT-450/r/ABT-267 plus ABT-333 with or without ribavirin (RBV)
ABT-450/r/ABT-267 plus ABT-333 with or without ribavirin (RBV)
ABT-450/r/ABT-267 plus ABT-333 with or without ribavirin (RBV)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Males and females at least 18 years old at screening
2. Females must be post-menopausal for more than 2 years or surgically sterile or practicing acceptable forms of birth control
3. Chronic hepatitis C, genotype 1 infection
4. Males must be surgically sterile or agree to practice acceptable forms of birth control
5. Screening laboratory result indicating HCV genotype 1 infection
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Use of contraindicated medications within 2 weeks of dosing
2. Abnormal laboratory tests
3. Current or past clinical evidence of Child-Pugh B or C classification or history of liver decompensation
4. Confirmed presence of hepatocellular carcinoma
5. History of solid organ transplant

patient_data.ipd_description: AbbVie is committed to responsible data sharing regarding the clinical trials we sponsor. This includes access to anonymized, individual and trial-level data (analysis data sets), as well as other information (e.g., protocols and clinical study reports), as long as the trials are not part of an ongoing or planned regulatory submission. This includes requests for clinical trial data for unlicensed products and indications.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data requests can be submitted at any time and the data will be accessible for 12 months, with possible extensions considered.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access to this clinical trial data can be requested by any qualified researchers who engage in rigorous, independent scientific research, and will be provided following review and approval of a research proposal and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and execution of a Data Sharing Agreement (DSA). For more information on the process, or to submit a request, visit the following link.
